@kepano: Buy wisely
Whenever I buy things I try to prioritize cost per use. Sometimes I consider other priorities such as cost per smile, cost per thrill, cost per externality, and cost per lesson.
Cost per use
Cost per use is a heuristic that helps me make decisions about mostâ€¦

item.title: @kepano: RT by @kepano: @danallison Leaders of organizations are often afraid of giving employees decisionmaking agency so they install bureaucracyOS aâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Leaders of organizations are often afraid of giving employees decisionmaking agency so they install bureaucracyOS as an operating system to filter out bad decisions, but in the process they also filter out good decisions that could have been made quickly

if you imbue people withâ€¦

â€” kepano (@kepano) September 27, 2023

Many ways to extend Obsidian beyond plugins:

- bookmarklets, e.g. Web Clipper
- browser extensions, e.g. MarkDownload
- python scripts, e.g. obsidian-metadata
- publishing tools, e.g. Quartz

since Obsidian data is all local and interoperable there is a broad design space â˜ºï¸ https://t.co/t9HopdfY0G

â€” kepano (@kepano) September 26, 2023

@kepano: bureaucracyOS is a viral operating system because it prioritizes bottom-up alignment over getting things done
most orgs have bottom-up alignment and top-down decisionmaking, but the opposite is more effective

item.title:
@kepano: A principle is only useful if you can legitimately take the opposite side.
Otherwise it's simply an aspiration that everyone else is also shooting for.
item.content:encoded:
A principle is only useful if you can legitimately take the opposite side.

Otherwise it's simply an aspiration that everyone else is also shooting for.

â€” kepano (@kepano) August 24, 2023

From a traditional business perspective the Obsidian approach has many downsides:

we can only focus on 1-2 things at a time, we can't build lots of stuff in parallel like a bigger company can

we have to cover our costs, we can't subsidize pricing â€” charging a fair price is aâ€¦

â€” kepano (@kepano) August 24, 2023

The plan for Obsidian is to never grow beyond 10-12 people, never take VC funding, never collect personal data or analytics.

Continue building with the assumption that software is ephemeral, files matter more than apps. Use formats that are open and durable.

See our manifesto: pic.twitter.com/UGBK9fmiQL

â€” kepano (@kepano) August 24, 2023

item.title:

item.content:encoded:

Adds search syntax for Properties and lots of small improvements

- Find notes with a property: [property]
- Find notes with a property + value: [property:value]

Both property and value allow complex sub-queries, such asâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/WsIAoyuJdj

HTTP status codes you should know

The response codes for HTTP are divided into five categories:

Informational (100-199)
Success (200-299)
Redirection (300-399)
Client Error (400-499)
Server Error (500-599)

These codes are defined in RFC 9110. To save you from reading theâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/EYEkWKAy6I
